intro: Zigadenus vaginatus, commonly known as the death camas, is a toxic plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are grass-like and basal, while its stems are often unbranched and erect. Due to its high toxicity, it is important to avoid ingestion or contact with this plant.
